# Data Visualizations

Here are some example visualizations using dummy data to showcase basic data analysis and visualization skills in R.

---

## 1. Sales by Product (Bar Chart)

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

# Example of sales data
products <- c("Product A", "Product B", "Product C", "Product D")
sales <- c(150, 230, 180, 90)
df <- data.frame(products, sales)

# Bar chart
ggplot(df, aes(x=products, y=sales, fill=products)) +
  geom_bar(stat="identity") +
  scale_fill_manual(values=c("#e3b778", "#f4e1c1", "#b35e0d", "#f7d9a1")) +
  theme_minimal(base_family = "Georgia") +
  labs(title="Sales by Product", x="Product", y="Units Sold") +
  theme(legend.position = "none", plot.title = element_text(size=16, face="bold"))

# Dummy monthly revenue

months <- factor(month.abb, levels=month.abb)
revenue <- c(500, 600, 550, 620, 700, 750, 800, 780, 720, 690, 650, 700)
df2 <- data.frame(months, revenue)

# Line chart

ggplot(df2, aes(x=months, y=revenue, group=1)) +
geom_line(color="#b35e0d", size=1.2) +
geom_point(color="#e3b778", size=3) +
theme_minimal(base_family = "Georgia") +
labs(title="Monthly Revenue Trend", x="Month", y="Revenue ($)") +
theme(plot.title = element_text(size=16, face="bold"))
```
